metadata.Title: CVE-2023-45871 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/net/ethernet/intel/igb/igb_main.c in theIGB driver in the Linux kernel before 6.5.3. A buffer size may not beadequate for frames larger than the MTU.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-45871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-167-generic - 5.4.0-167.184
linux-image-5.4.0-167-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-167.184
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-167-generic - 5.4.0-167.184
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-167-lowlatency - 5.4.0-167.184
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-89.99~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-89.99~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-89.99~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic-64k - 5.15.0-89.99~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-kvm - 5.4.0-1103.110
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-89.99~20.04.1
